summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence from 2019 between federal prosecutors requesting and receiving approval for travel to conduct victim interviews and meetings in West Palm Beach, Florida, and Los Angeles, California, as part of the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein (United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618). The emails detail logistical planning for trips involving multiple prosecutors to interview victims in the sex trafficking case.

connections.description: They are colleagues and co-prosecutors working together on the Epstein investigation, coordinating travel for victim interviews.

events.title: Planned Victim Interview in West Palm Beach
events.description: Prosecutors request travel approval to conduct a victim interview in West Palm Beach, Florida, on this date, including reserving a hotel conference room.

events.title: Planned Victim Interview in Los Angeles
events.description: Prosecutors request travel approval to conduct a victim interview in Los Angeles, California, tentatively scheduled for a Thursday in June 2019.

events.title: Planned Meetings and Interviews in West Palm Beach
events.description: Prosecutors request travel approval for approximately three days of meetings and interviews with victims in West Palm Beach, Florida.

events.title: Travel Approval Granted
events.description: A travel approval request for the Epstein investigation is approved via email.

events.title: Initial Travel Request for Florida Meetings
events.description: Prosecutors S and M request permission to travel for two days of meetings and interviews in West Palm Beach and/or Fort Lauderdale, Florida, for the Epstein investigation.

keyFacts: The document references the federal criminal case 'United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618,' described as an investigation relating to the enticement of minors for sexual activity.
It reveals ongoing investigative activity by federal prosecutors in 2019, specifically travel to conduct victim interviews in multiple cities (West Palm Beach, Los Angeles).
The emails show a pattern of prosecutors requesting permission to reserve hotel conference rooms for conducting victim interviews, suggesting a formal, secure setting for these meetings.
The correspondence indicates coordination among a team of prosecutors (S and M, with others implied) from the Southern District of New York working on the Epstein investigation.
The travel requests span from March to November 2019, showing sustained investigative efforts in the months leading up to Epstein's arrest in July 2019.
